title: Shaping Perspectives Through Knowledge
prompt:
Show how your knowledge of a text’s context shaped your understanding of a perspective it
communicated.

title: Transforming Text, Shifting Interpretations
prompt:
Explore the effects on your interpretation when a text was transformed into another genre or
medium.

title: Engaging with Critical Issues
prompt: Discuss how a text engages with issues or ideas significant within its context.

title: Redefining Genre Boundaries
prompt:
Discuss how a text extended your understanding of its genre by incorporating or manipulating
conventions in ways you did not expect.

title: Questioning Assumptions Through Close Analysis
prompt: Show how close analysis of a text led you to question the assumptions and/or values within it.

title: Language Features That Challenge Perspectives
prompt:
Evaluate how the perspective in a text was offered through the selection of language features
that generate controversy.

title: Reimagining Common Experiences
prompt: Compose an interpretive text which represents a common event or experience in a new light.

title: Persuading and Commending Community
prompt: Craft a voice, in a persuasive form, that seeks to reassure or commend a community.

title: Imagining the Name Unrevealed
prompt:
Craft an imaginative text that develops a perspective inspired by the following line:
‘I will never be able to speak my real name, the name I was born with, if I had ever been given
one at all.’

title: From Image Inspiration to Genre Transformation
prompt:
Compose two short texts inspired by the image below, where the second adapts the first into a
different genre.

title: Bridging Contexts Through Text
prompt:
With reference to at least one text, discuss why a text created in one context may resonate with
an audience in another context.

title: Unveiling New Meanings in Transformation
prompt:
Evaluate how a text’s meaning changed when it was transformed into a different genre or
medium.

title: Evaluating Perspectives Through Diverse Interpretations
prompt: Consider how other interpretations of a text helped you evaluate its perspective/s

title: Conforming and Challenging Audience Expectations
prompt:
Explain how at least one text conforms to generic conventions while still challenging its
audience.

title: Reflecting on Life's Subtle Moments
prompt:
Our greatest experiences are our quietest moments’.
Create an interpretive text in which you reflect on this quotation.

title: Enhancing Ideas Through Form
prompt:
Create a text in a form of your choice that experiments with structural features to enhance its
central idea.

title: The Impact of Marginalised Voices
prompt:
Discuss how your awareness of the omissions and/or marginalisations within a text shaped your
response to its perspective(s).

title: Analyzing Genre-Specific Choices
prompt:
With reference to at least one text, discuss the stylistic choices made by a creator in
constructing a text within a particular genre.

title: Reflecting Context Through Narrative Tone
prompt: Explore how voice within at least one text reflects the values and attitudes of a particular context.

title: Infusing Deeper Meaning Through the Human Voice
prompt:
‘Words mean more than what is set down on paper. It takes the human voice to infuse them with
deeper meaning.’
In a form of your choice, explore the ideas within the quote above.

title: Crafting Imaginative Conclusions
prompt:
Craft an imaginative text which concludes with the following line:
‘Some say bossy, I say benevolent overlord.’

title: Reinterpreting Travel Through New Perspectives
prompt:
‘One’s destination is never a place but rather a new way of looking at things.’
Using this idea as a central theme, construct an interpretive text that reflects on a travel
experience.

title: Uncovering Identity Through Text
prompt:
Show how at least one text reveals that the values of individuals are shaped by their
circumstances.

title: Weaving Multiple Perspectives
prompt: Explore how different perspectives on a controversy have been represented in at least one text.

title: Revealing Inner Conflicts Through Voice
prompt: Discuss how voice has been crafted to reveal an inner or hidden conflict in at least one text.

title: Disrupting Audiences with Language and Structure
prompt:
How have language or structural innovations been used to unsettle an audience in at least one
text?

title: Imagination in Unconventional Settings
prompt: Create an imaginative text in a particular genre but with an atypical setting.

title: Persuading a Resistant Audience
prompt:
‘I don’t think you quite understand the ramifications of this decision.’
Incorporate this statement into a persuasive text for a resistant audience.

title: Lessons Through Personal Connections
prompt:
Compose an interpretive text to represent an encounter with a person who taught you something
about yourself.
